de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.uomm

Class IntelligentDriverMotion

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.mobisim.core.ExtensionModule
      • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.mobisim.mobilitymodels.Movement
        • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.uomm.UserOrientedMovement
          • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.uomm.IntelligentDriverMotion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NotificationListener, XMLStreamable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IDM_IM

    public class IntelligentDriverMotion
extends UserOrientedMovement
    This class implements Intelligent Driver Motion Behavior. The implementation is based on M. Treiber and D. Helbing, "Explanation of Observed Features of Self-Organization in Traffic Flow", Preprint cond-mat/9901239 (1999).

    Patches:

    Version 1.2 by Marco Fiore (fiore@tlc.polito.it) on 06/12/2005:
         Added support for multidirectional and multiflow roads

    Version 1.3 by Marco Fiore (fiore@tlc.polito.it) on 22/05/2006:
         Speed attribute moved at Movement class level

    Version 1.4 by Marco Fiore (fiore@tlc.polito.it) and Jerome Haerri (haerri@eurecom.fr) on 20/09/2006:
         Multi-segment roads and speed limits support

    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    1.0-1.1 Illya Stepanov, 1.2-1.3 Marco Fiore, 1.4 Marco Fiore and Jerome Haerri

      • act

        public int act()
        Executes the extension.

        The method is called on every simulation timestep.
        Specified by:
        act in class ExtensionModule
        Returns:
        0 - the module should be executed on next timesteps, -1 - the module should not be executed on further timesteps and should be removed from the extensions' list
